screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .gdm file in MilkyTracker
screenshot.caption: GDM file open in MilkyTracker

description: Bells, Whistles, and Sound Boards (BWSB) was a DOS-based sound library that video game developers and demoscene enthusiasts used to create and play music in the 1990s. Notably, BWSB was included in MegaZeux, a game creation system that was also available for MS-DOS.
Music created to be played by BWSB was saved as GDM files. These files describe the notes a song contains, how those notes are arranged, and the instruments used to play those notes.
